node.title: 'Open heart surgery': Roof removal a breakthrough on $154m cathedral restoration
node.description: Christ Church Cathedral restorers hope construction workers can venture inside the building by Christmas.

node.title: In the spotlight: New Zealanders at the Oscars through the years
node.description: How often do Kiwis in the film industry get recognised by the Academy? New Zealand's history with the golden statue goes all the way back to 1980.

node.title: Iditarod punishes 3 mushers for sheltering dogs in fierce windstorm
node.description: "Cruelty is baked into this deadly race, and it's time for it to stop," PETA said in a statement.

node.title: 63 million Americans in the crosshairs of dangerous storms
node.description: Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas — all of which saw tornado warnings last week — could potentially see them again over the next few days.

node.title: Jada Pinkett Smith brings public awareness to alopecia
node.description: Pinkett Smith said her diagnosis was "terrifying" and that she discovered handfuls of her hair were falling out in the shower.

node.title: Online video shows girl fatally shooting cousin and herself
node.description: "They were playing with the gun, when they shouldn't have been," the girl's grandmother said.

node.title: Biden administration unveils 2023 federal budget proposal
node.description: The more than $5.7 trillion proposal is just the first step in the lengthy budget process.

node.title: Russia to bar entry for people from growing list of "unfriendly" nations
node.description: Putin's war in Ukraine has brought an unprecedented "economic blitzkrieg" down on his own country. This is an effort at "retaliatory" measures.

node.title: Top Russian newspaper forced to halt publication over Ukraine war
node.description: The paper said it had received a second warning from Russia's media regulator - meaning a Russian court could shut it down.

node.title: Could Will Smith's slap cost him his Oscar?
node.description: The academy's code of standards asks its members to behave ethically and uphold its "values of respect for human dignity, inclusion and a supportive environment that fosters creativity."

node.title: Chris Rock declines to press charges against Will Smith, LAPD says
node.description: "Wow, wow — Will Smith just smacked the s*** out of me," Rock said as Smith returned to his seat after the slap seen around the world.

node.title: Applebee's franchise exec says pricey gas will let them cut pay
node.description: A leaked memo said that because its pool of workers live "paycheck to paycheck," high gas prices will "force people back into the work force."

node.title: 47,000 California grocery workers authorize possible strike
node.description: Employees at Albertsons, Pavilions, Ralphs and Vons stores in the state are demanding a $5 per hour raise.

node.title: Celebrities react to Will Smith slapping Chris Rock
node.description: Even people who didn't watch the Oscars on Sunday night likely heard about "the slap." And many celebrities — regardless of whether they saw it in person — have shared their reactions.

node.title: Israel hosts Blinken, top Arab diplomats as Mideast dynamic shifts
node.description: Israel's top diplomat said the gathering, which will be repeated annually, was an opportunity to intimidate and deter "common enemies, first and foremost Iran."

node.title: Amazon workers press ahead with plans to unionize
node.description: Warehouse workers at the ecommerce giant are pushing for better working conditions, longer breaks and higher wages.

node.title: Was Putin's playbook for Ukraine written in Syria?
node.description: Syrian eyewitnesses detail the torture endured as Russia stepped in to help Bashar Al-Assad remain in power.

node.title: Talks to resume as Russia bombs Ukrainian families out of their homes
node.description: "What is left for us?" asked one resident of the besieged city of Mariupol who escaped Russia's relentless, grinding bid to seize Ukrainian territory.

node.title: CBS News and The Weather Channel announce partnership
node.description: Groundbreaking collaboration showcases cutting-edge "virtual forecasts," live coverage from across the country and investigative climate reporting.

node.title: Jeff Carson, country music star turned police officer, dead at 58
node.description: The singer and songwriter scored hits with "Not On Your Love" and "The Car" before becoming a police officer.

node.title: 19 found dead after shooting at cockfight venue in Mexico
node.description: Federal authorities are working "with the aim of capturing those responsible for the violent acts," authorities said.

node.title: 2022 Oscars: Awards, speeches and highlights
node.description: "CODA" wins Best Picture, while Will Smith has a big win and a shocking dispute on stage at the Academy Awards.

node.title: 1839 gold medal called the "most shocking" discovery in years
node.description: The unique solid gold medal, which is in immaculate condition, could fetch half a million dollars at auction.

node.title: Colorado woman dies after falling into rapids at Grand Canyon
node.description: Boaters pulled Mary Kelley out of the water but their administration of CPR and subsequent resuscitation efforts by park rangers were unsuccessful, officials said.

node.title: Elon Musk says he "supposedly" has COVID again, but few symptoms
node.description: Apparently referring to COVID-19 variants, Musk said, "Covid-19 is the virus of Theseus. How many gene changes before it's not Covid-19 anymore?

node.title: Details emerge about teen who fell to his death from thrill ride
node.description: Tyre Sampson was describes as "an honor roll student, an aspiring athlete and a kind-hearted person."

node.title: China locks down Shanghai as Omicron fuels record surge in COVID cases
node.description: Locking down the entire global financial hub's population of 25 million all at once was deemed too big a risk, so it has been split in half for a phased shutdown.

node.title: Ice shelf collapse in East Antarctica is a first for that region
node.description: And it's got scientists worried. The shelf was the size of New York City. East Antarctica is an area long thought to be stable and not hit much by climate change.

node.title: Dollywood closes thrill ride similar to one involved in Fla. tragedy
node.description: The Tennessee amusement park says its Drop Line is a 230-foot tall tower made by Funtime Rides from Austria. So was the Orlando ride where a teen fell to his death.

node.title: Car slams into homeless encampment, killing four and injuring three
node.description: The alleged driver was arrested hours later and charged with manslaughter and reckless endangerment. Authorities say they suspect alcohol may have played a role.
